div.font: // Always prefer using an informer factory to get a shared informer instead of getting an independent
// one. This reduces memory footprint and number of connections to the server.

pre.font: // syncDeployment will sync the deployment with the given key.

div.font: // This function is not meant to be invoked concurrently with the same key.

pre.div: func (dc *DeploymentController) syncDeployment(ctx context.Context, key string) error {
klog.ErrorS(err, "Failed to split meta namespace cache key", "cacheKey", key)
klog.V(4).InfoS("Started syncing deployment", "deployment", klog.KRef(namespace, name), "startTime", startTime)
klog.V(4).InfoS("Finished syncing deployment", "deployment", klog.KRef(namespace, name), "duration", time.Since(startTime))

div.font: // list deployment in namespace

pre.div: klog.V(2).InfoS("Deployment has been deleted", "deployment", klog.KRef(namespace, name))

div.font: // Deep-copy otherwise we are mutating our cache.
// TODO: Deep-copy only when needed.

pre.div: dc.eventRecorder.Eventf(d, v1.EventTypeWarning, "SelectingAll", "This deployment is selecting all pods. A non-empty selector is required.")

div.font: // List ReplicaSets owned by this Deployment, while reconciling ControllerRef
// through adoption/orphaning.
// List all Pods owned by this Deployment, grouped by their ReplicaSet.
// Current uses of the podMap are:
// * check if a Pod is labeled correctly with the pod-template-hash label.
// * check that no old Pods are running in the middle of Recreate Deployments.
// Update deployment conditions with an Unknown condition when pausing/resuming
// a deployment. In this way, we can be sure that we won't timeout when a user
// resumes a Deployment with a set progressDeadlineSeconds.

pre.div: if err = dc.checkPausedConditions(ctx, d); err != nil {

div.font: // rollback is not re-entrant in case the underlying replica sets are updated with a new
// revision so we should ensure that we won't proceed to update replica sets until we

pre.div: // make sure that the deployment has cleaned up its rollback spec in subsequent enqueues.
return fmt.Errorf("unexpected deployment strategy type: %s", d.Spec.Strategy.Type)
